meanings.sent1: After making a mistake, he quickly restrikes the nail to fix it.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith carefully restrikes the hot iron to shape it perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The chef restrikes the dough to ensure the cookies turn out just right.
meanings.sent4: The teacher restrikes the chalkboard to emphasize the important point.
meanings.sent5: The artist restrikes the canvas to add more depth to the painting.

meanings.definition: A new impression or printing of a coin or medal using the original die
meanings.sent1: The collector was excited to add the rare restrikes to his coin collection.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed the restrikes of ancient coins for visitors to admire.
meanings.sent3: The auction house mistakenly sold the restrikes at a lower price.
meanings.sent4: The numismatist carefully examined the restrikes to determine their authenticity.
meanings.sent5: The restrikes of the medal were beautifully detailed and highly sought after.

meanings.definition: A new printing of a book or other printed material using the original plates or blocks
meanings.sent1: The publisher decided to create restrikes of the classic novel for the anniversary edition.
meanings.sent2: The bookstore received a shipment of restrikes of the bestselling book.
meanings.sent3: The librarian accidentally ordered restrikes of the wrong book series.
meanings.sent4: The author signed copies of the restrikes at the book signing event.
meanings.sent5: The restrikes of the magazine cover were vibrant and eye-catching.
